data.text:
Sweeney Todd was a disturbing movie that made me feel anxious, as the plot progressed. This movie was a musical about Sweeney Todd wanted to take out on the town because of the loss of his family. The entire look of this movie starting from the color of the town to the makeup, costumes, and the design of the city itself, made me feel a bit unease. To narrow down the main elements that gave me discomfort is the visuals, singing, the little use lighting and how the movie is supposed to be viewed as unrealistic. As the movie grows with tension, rage, and killing my feelings grew stronger. The visuals and the singing that went along with the movie are a couple of elements contribute to my feelings. For example, I was also a little overwhelmed with how the camera showed Mr. Todd letting their bodies hit the basement floor, as if they were nothing, but objects. When the village people were eating the meat pies and, even though they did not know that they were eating people, it was disturbing that they were enjoying it and coming back for more. The biggest visual effect is the way the blood would squirt out of their …show more content…

I think that the producers’ goal for this movie was just to entertain the viewers by giving them a little sense of reality. For example, in the beginning of the movie, it starts in a real place, London, but as the movie progress it becomes a more unbelievable place. A couple of reasons why I do not believe it is verisimilitude because the cast was singing during the movie about how they were going to kill people and no one, but the old woman notice something was not right about Mrs. Lovett’s bakery. Another reason is the way the blood poured out of the victims' necks. Many of the death scenes liked a mentioned before was unrealistic. Even though verisimilitude was not an important factor in this movie the movie still an unorthodox and alarming
